files.README.md:
# Usage Tracker Plugin

Captures all Claude Code usage patterns and generates skills from repeated workflows.

## Features

- **Automatic Tracking**: Records all prompts, tool usage, and sessions
- **Pattern Detection**: Identifies repeated prompts and common tool sequences
- **Skill Generation**: Creates reusable skills from your workflows
- **Analytics**: View usage statistics and trends

## Data Storage

All data is stored locally at `~/.claude/usage-tracker/usage.db` (SQLite).

## Commands

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/usage-tracker:stats` | View usage statistics |
| `/usage-tracker:analyze` | Analyze patterns and get skill suggestions |
| `/usage-tracker:generate-skill [pattern]` | Generate a skill from a pattern |
| `/usage-tracker:export [format]` | Export data (json, csv, markdown) |

## What Gets Tracked

- **Sessions**: Start/end times, project paths
- **Prompts**: Full text, timestamps, similarity hashes
- **Tool Usage**: Tool names, inputs, outputs, durations
- **Patterns**: Detected workflows and repeated behaviors

## Privacy

- All data stays local on your machine
- No external transmission
- Delete `~/.claude/usage-tracker/` to remove all data

## Skill Generation

After using Claude Code for a while, run `/usage-tracker:analyze` to see:
- Repeated prompt patterns
- Common tool sequences
- Suggested skills to generate

Then use `/usage-tracker:generate-skill` to create reusable skills from your patterns.
